de.kasoki.jfeedly.helper

Class HTTPConnections

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.kasoki.jfeedly.helper.HTTPConnections

  • public class HTTPConnections
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for HTTP connections

      HTTPConnections(JFeedly feedly)
      Create a new HTTP connections helper for the given handler

      • sendPostRequestToFeedly

        public java.lang.String sendPostRequestToFeedly(java.lang.String apiUrl,
                                       java.lang.String urlParameters)
        Send a POST request to the feedly servers
        Parameters:
        apiUrl - the API url, usually starts with "/v3/...."
        urlParameters - this field is used for parameters and body
        Returns:
        The response from the server, usually a JSON String

      • sendPostRequestToFeedly

        public java.lang.String sendPostRequestToFeedly(java.lang.String apiUrl,
                                       java.lang.String urlParameters,
                                       boolean isAuthenticated)
        Send a POST request to the feedly servers
        Parameters:
        apiUrl - the API url, usually starts with "/v3/...."
        urlParameters - this field is used for parameters and body
        isAuthenticated - Set to true if the client is authenticated (This will add the OAuth key to the headers)
        Returns:
        The response from the server, usually a JSON String

      • sendPostRequestToFeedly

        public java.lang.String sendPostRequestToFeedly(java.lang.String apiUrl,
                                       java.lang.String urlParameters,
                                       boolean isAuthenticated,
                                       java.lang.String contentType)
        Send a POST request to the feedly servers
        Parameters:
        apiUrl - the API url, usually starts with "/v3/...."
        urlParameters - this field is used for parameters and body
        isAuthenticated - Set to true if the client is authenticated (This will add the OAuth key to the headers)
        contentType - Set another content type
        Returns:
        The response from the server, usually a JSON String
